summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to Sigrid, following up on a request to review journal entries and other documents from a witness (referred to as 'her') regarding her experiences with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The email seeks cooperation to assist in the investigation.

persons.name: Sigrid
persons.context: Addressed in the email regarding a follow-up request for journal entries from a witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a subject of the investigation, with the witness's experiences involving him being relevant.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Epstein as a subject of the investigation, with the witness's experiences involving her being relevant.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, requesting journal entries and documents from a witness to assist in the investigation of Epstein and Maxwell.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the investigation, with the witness's experiences involving both individuals.
The prosecutor is communicating with Sigrid to request documents from a witness for the investigation.

events.title: Follow-up request for witness journal entries
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails Sigrid to follow up on a request for journal entries and other documents from a witness regarding her experiences with Epstein and Maxwell.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a follow-up email from a federal prosecutor seeking journal entries and other documents from a witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
The witness had previously been interviewed and referred to journal entries that helped refresh her recollection of events involving Epstein and Maxwell.
The prosecutor's office is actively investigating Epstein and Maxwell, as indicated by the request for documentary evidence.
The email is dated January 10, 2020, showing ongoing investigative efforts after Epstein's death in August 2019.
The witness's identity is not disclosed in the text, but her journal entries are considered important for the investigation.
